fields.value: ABC News/Washington Post Politics Poll, February 2003

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This poll is part of a series of monthly surveys that solicit public opinion on the presidency and on a range of other political and social issues. Respondents were asked to give their opinion
s of President George W. Bush and his performance in relation to possible military action in Iraq and North Korea and the economy. They were also asked about the space program in light of the space shuttle Columbia crash and the future of the manned space shuttle flights, the case for action in Iraq and how the position of the United Nations and other countries would affect the actions of the United States in Iraq, and the possible long- and short-term effects of military intervention in Iraq. Background information on respondents includes age, sex, political orientation, education, and ethnicity.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIV.C.1. Mass Political Behavior and Attitudes, Public Opinion on Political Matters, United States

When appropriate, documentation has been converted to Portable Document Format (PDF), data files have been converted to non-platform-specific formats, and variables have been recoded to ensure respondents' privacy.; Subject: null  Type: null  Notes: SPSS portable file(s), and electronic documentation.;

distributorName.value: Inter-university Consortium for Political and Social Research

distributorAffiliation.value: Institute for Social Research, University of Michigan

value: Persons aged 18 and over living in households with telephones in the contiguous 48 United States.

fields.value: Households were selected by random-digit dialing. Within households, the respondent selected was the adult living in the household who last had a birthday and who was home at the time of the interview.
